title: Sound Work: All Systems Go
publication_title: The Modern Series at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">Eric Leonardson (American, born 1958)  
All Systems Go  
2017  
Digital sound collage; 14 min. loop  
Courtesy of the artist  

Musical compositions used in this work: Conlon Nancarrow, “Studies for Player Piano, Study #1,” 1948; Hugh Le Caine, “Dripsody: An Étude for Variable Speed Recorder (Mono Version),” 1955; Bernard Parmegiani, “L’oeil Ecouté,” 1970; Pierre Schaeffer, “Cinq Études de Bruits—Chemins de Fer,” 1948; Eric Leonardson, “Chase,” 1996; Edgar Varèse, “Poème Electronique,” 1958; Iannis Xenakis, “Concret PH,” 1958; Walter Ruttmann, “Wochenende,” 1930; John Cage, “Williams Mix,” 1952; Henri Pousseur, “Scambi,” 1957; Bill Fontana, “Harmonic Bridge,” 2006.  

Documentary sounds used in this work: Car approach and skid; pilot to air traffic controller communication; radio and TV sounds; high-performance car burnout; ambulance passing with siren; vintage movie camera in operation; jet flyover; liftoff of Apollo 11 at Cape Kennedy, Florida, on July 16, 1969; 16mm film projector playing loop of found film; Stuka JU-87 dive bombers and explosions; horse galloping.

</section><section id="figures">Eric Leonardson, 2017

</section>
